      • getRelativePath

        public static java.nio.file.Path getRelativePath(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                 @Nullable
                                 java.nio.file.Path baseDir)
        Get the path of a file relative to a base directory.
        Parameters:
        path - must reference a file, not a directory.
        baseDir - must reference a directory that is relative to a common directory with the path. may be null if referencing the same directory as the path.
        Returns:
        the relative path of path from the directory baseDir.

      • relativize

        public static java.nio.file.Path relativize(java.nio.file.Path path1,
                            java.nio.file.Path path2)
        Get a relative path from path1 to path2, first normalizing each path. This method is a workaround for JDK-6925169 (Path.relativize returns incorrect result if path contains "." or "..").

      • normalize

        public static java.nio.file.Path normalize(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Get a path without unnecessary path parts. This method is a workaround for JDK-8037945 (Paths.get("").normalize() throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException).

      • createRelativeSymlink

        public static java.nio.file.Path createRelativeSymlink(java.nio.file.Path pathToDesiredLinkUnderProjectRoot,
                                       java.nio.file.Path pathToExistingFileUnderProjectRoot,
                                       ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a symlink at projectFilesystem.getRootPath().resolve(pathToDesiredLinkUnderProjectRoot) that points to projectFilesystem.getRootPath().resolve(pathToExistingFileUnderProjectRoot) using a relative symlink.
        Parameters:
        pathToDesiredLinkUnderProjectRoot - must reference a file, not a directory.
        pathToExistingFileUnderProjectRoot - must reference a file, not a directory.
        Returns:
        the relative path from the new symlink that was created to the existing file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createRelativeSymlink

        public static java.nio.file.Path createRelativeSymlink(java.nio.file.Path pathToDesiredLinkUnderProjectRoot,
                                       java.nio.file.Path pathToExistingFileUnderProjectRoot,
                                       java.nio.file.Path pathToProjectRoot)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a symlink at pathToProjectRoot.resolve(pathToDesiredLinkUnderProjectRoot) that points to pathToProjectRoot.resolve(pathToExistingFileUnderProjectRoot) using a relative symlink. Both params must be relative to the project root.
        Parameters:
        pathToDesiredLinkUnderProjectRoot - must reference a file, not a directory.
        pathToExistingFileUnderProjectRoot - must reference a file, not a directory.
        Returns:
        the relative path from the new symlink that was created to the existing file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • asPaths

        public static ImmutableSortedSet<java.nio.file.Path> asPaths(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> paths)
        Convert a set of input file paths as strings to Path objects.

      • filterForSubpaths

        public static ImmutableSet<java.nio.file.Path> filterForSubpaths(java.lang.Iterable<java.nio.file.Path> paths,
                                                 java.nio.file.Path root)
        Filters out Path objects from paths that aren't a subpath of root and returns a set of paths relative to root.

      • isGeneratedFile

        public static boolean isGeneratedFile(java.nio.file.Path pathRelativeToProjectRoot)
        Returns:
        Whether the input path directs to a file in the buck generated files folder.

      • expandHomeDir

        public static java.nio.file.Path expandHomeDir(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Expands "~/foo" into "/home/zuck/foo". Returns regular paths unmodified.
